description: From Middle English *rightere, from Old English rihtere (“a ruler; director”), from Proto-Germanic *rehtārijaz, equivalent to right +‎ -er (agent suffix). Cognate with Saterland Frisian Gjuchter (“one who makes right; judge”), West Frisian rjochter (“one who makes right; judge”), Dutch rechter (“one who makes right; judge”), German Low German Richter (“one who makes right; judge”), German Richter (“one who makes right; judge”), Icelandic réttari (“a justiciary”).

entries.meaning: One who sets right; one who does justice or redresses wrong.

description: From Middle English rightere, rihtere, from Old English rihtra, comparative of riht (“right”), equivalent to right +‎ -er (comparative suffix).

entries.meaning: comparative form of right: more right
